result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Kuruc was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 311 days, if revoked.
Deft accepted into Drug Court Program.  
Drug court scheduled for 3/2/16 @ 3:30pm.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $7052.00 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with victims, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Report to Drug Court every Wednesday at 3:30pm.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
All counts are Concurrent to each other but Consecutive to Dane Co case 16CF1640.
Any unpaid court obligations are still to be collected.
***AJOC - Credit for 349 days.
***2nd AJOC - Credit for 352 days

records.addlTxt: Def. should be given 348 days credit on 15CF112 and 349 days credit on 15CF356.  JOC to be amended to reflect the correction.  (NO DOCUMENT AVAILABLE PER INTEGRITY CHECK OF FILE / PT)
for Sentence Credit filed by the Def.

Filed by ADA Tracey Braun:  the State objects to the amount of credit the def. suggests is appropriate.  But they do agree with DOC that on 15CF112 the def. would be entitled to 348 days credit, instead of 310 days, and on 15CF356, the def. would be entitled to 349 days, instead of 311.  The extra time requested as credit by the def. was applied to Dane Co case 16CF1640 and the def. would not be eligible to receive that time as credit as the sentences were to run consecutively.

Defendant Thomas J. Kuruc appeared with Attorney William Michel.  Defendant in custody.  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the Prosecution.  Agent Jacqueline Gatlin in court.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel Escape-Crim Arrest, Ct 2-Fel BJ, Repeater, Ct 4-Misd BJ, Repeater & Ct 5-Misd Crim Dam to Property, Repeater; found guilty by the court.  Cts 3 & 6-10 were all dismissed and read-in.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  PSI report waived.
Cts 1, 2, 4, 5:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 48 months w/conditions; as a condition of probation, the defendant to serve 1 day in the KCJ, forthwith.  310 days sentence credit given if revoked.  Court costs ordered.  No rest. requested.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.  Defendant accepted into the Drug Court Program.  Drug court scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Drug Court

Per ADA Tracey Braun, def. has been accepted into the Drug Court program.  Status conf. in Br. 8 on 2/10/16 at 9:30 is removed from the calendar.  Plea and sentencing in Br. 4 scheduled for 2/10/16 at 3:15.  Parties notified by email.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty William Michel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. has an assessment today to see if he qualifies for participation in the Drug Court.  Status conf. 2/10/16 at 9:30.  Bond continued.
